summary: Merlin, a famous character in King Arthur legends, is known for his magic powers. He was first described by Geoffrey of Monmouth in the 12th century, who combined stories of two Welsh prophets. Merlin is often shown as a powerful wizard, born from a human mother and a supernatural father. He helps King Arthur come to power and acts as his advisor. Some tales say he was trapped or killed by the Lady of the Lake, while others tell of his retirement or death. Merlin's story has been very popular in medieval literature.
title: Merlin
